title: Why did China ban K-Pop in China? - Quora

response.answer_text: China bans so much of South Korean content due to tensions in the government. China doesn’t approve of anything, well, “un-Chinese,” basically. Since China and Korea are tense due to Korea deploying an American missile defense system, China doesn’t want to promote anything Korean because they don’t agree with what Korea is doing politically. They also won’t want Korea to be benefiting off of the entertainment market in their country. Also, China has to sign off on all of the content that enters the country, including the Kpop concerts, merchandise, Kdramas, etc. Most recently, however, China is starting to loosen its ban on Kpop and Korean entertainment. This could be a step towards a less difficult relationship between Korea and China.

Because of the THAAD, and also because Chinese government was worried about the Korean entertainment industry affecting the Chinese entertainment industry too much. It was banned for 18 months - as of Nov 2017 it has not been banned, and Kpop concerts are supposedly being planned for late 2018 / early 2019 already. I personally think this was an overreaction by the Chinese government, but many Chinese people have justified this by saying “Korea chose USA over China and this is their punishment” I’m not sure if I agree but anyways I’m glad that its unbanned now.
